intro: Scrophularia alpestris var. fimbriata, commonly known as the Alpine figwort, is a flowering plant native to mountainous regions of Europe. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a rough, hairy texture and produces clusters of tubular, pink or purple flowers. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its adaptability to cold, high-altitude climates. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance in alpine ecosystems.
